title: How to Delete a Depop Listing or Mark As Sold

steps.title: Open Depop.
steps.content: Open Depop. This app icon looks like a lowercase "d" on a red background. Since deleting listings from your Depop account also deletes all the comments and reviews from that listing, you might decide that you want to keep it around. Marking the listing as sold will prevent others from purchasing the same listing, but keep it around for the reviews and comments.

steps.title: Go to your profile page.
steps.content: Go to your profile page. Tap the profile icon in the lower right corner of your screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the listing that you want to delete.
steps.content: Go to the listing that you want to delete. Once you're on your profile, you'll see listed all the items or listings you have created. Tap on one to see more. If there are no listings, create one.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This three-dot menu icon is in the top right corner of the listing. [2] X Research source The three-dot menu may be horizontal (•••) for you instead, but it'll be in the same top-right corner of the listing.

steps.title: Tap Delete item.
steps.content: Tap Delete item . If you don't see this immediately, you may need to scroll down in this pop-up window first. This may be at the bottom of your screen next to a trash can icon. Tap Ok to confirm and the item/listing will be deleted from your page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Depop.
steps.content: Open Depop. This app icon looks like a lowercase "d" on a red background.

steps.title: Go to your profile page.
steps.content: Go to your profile page. Tap the profile icon in the lower right corner of your screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the listing that you want to mark as sold.
steps.content: Go to the listing that you want to mark as sold. Once you're on your profile, you'll see listed all the items or listings you have created. Tap on one to see more options.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This three-dot menu icon is in the top right corner of the listing. [5] X Research source The three-dot menu may be horizontal (•••) for you instead, but it'll be in the same top-right corner of the listing. If the item is already marked as sold, you won't see the option to mark it again.

steps.title: Tap Mark item as sold.
steps.content: Tap Mark item as sold . This should be near the middle of the menu. If this option isn't visible to you, scroll down until you find it. Tap OK to continue. Refresh the page (swipe down from the top of your screen) and your listing will add "This item has been sold" to the description. No one will be able to purchase that item now. If you close the app and open it again, then navigate to your profile, you'll notice that the listing now has a "SOLD" watermark on it. [6] X Research source
